question1.title: What are the best ways to prepare for a behavioral co-op interview?
question1.text: I'm applying for a healthcare-related co-op and have my first behavioral interview next week. I’m comfortable with technical interviews, but I get nervous about behavioral ones. What kinds of questions should I expect, and how can I answer them effectively?

question2.title: How to tailor my resume for consulting vs. tech roles?
question2.text: I’m majoring in computer science with a consulting minor and plan to apply to both tech and consulting co-ops. Should I maintain separate resumes for each, or is there a good way to make one resume that fits both industries?

question3.title: What’s the best way to network at company info sessions?
question3.text: I’ve gone to a few employer sessions, but I always freeze up when it’s time to introduce myself. How can I make a good impression and actually build a meaningful connection instead of just saying hi and walking away?

question4.title: Balancing co-op work and classes — how do you manage it?
question4.text: Next semester I’ll be working part-time during my co-op while taking one course. Any tips for managing your time and avoiding burnout?

question5.title: How important is LinkedIn when applying for internships?
question5.text: I’ve heard recruiters sometimes check your LinkedIn before even reading your resume. What should I make sure to include or update to make my profile stand out?

question6.title: How do I know if a company’s culture will be a good fit?
question6.text: I’m looking at a few marketing co-ops but I’m worried about joining a team that’s too corporate or competitive. How can I tell what the culture is really like before accepting an offer?
